intro: Hylotelephium chongsunense, commonly known as the Chongju stonecrop, is a low-growing succulent plant native to China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or purple during the summer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact growth habit and drought tolerance. Hylotelephium chongsunense prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
